sneak.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard
sneak.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She snuck out of the house once her parents were asleep.
sneak.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to hide something and take it somewhere or give it to someone secretly
sneak.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Douglas had sneaked his camera into the show.
sneak.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to quickly and secretly steal something unimportant or of little value
sneak.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: We used to sneak cigarettes from Dad.
sneak.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a child who other children dislike, because they tell adults about bad things that the other children have done
sneak.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: someone who is not liked because they do things secretly and cannot be trusted
sneak.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: doing things very secretly and quickly, so that people do not notice you or cannot stop you
